titleStmt.title: David Board et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG11038

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To His Excellency B. Magoffin Govr of Kentucky --

The undersigned citizens of Mercer & Boyle Counties, respectfully petition your Excellency to pardon James Duddleson who is now confined in the state Penitentiary- they believe he ought to be pardoned, that some of us have heard the evidence on his trial, and would have acquitted him upon it -- And In view of the case and the time he has served, and the helpless condition of his wife and children we pray his pardon -- 8th Decr 1861

David Board
C. H. May.
J. R, Tewiney
T J Board
Dudley Barnett
Jackson Crain
Frank Westerfield
Pillip. S. Beswick
Jesse, Barnette
Frank Randolph
